themes.scientific_basis: Based on problem-solving theories and root-cause analysis techniques used in relationship counseling.
themes.description: This theme guides couples to dig deeper into recurring issues, identifying underlying causes rather than focusing on surface conflicts, creating pathways for lasting solutions.

themes.scientific_basis: Drawn from research on collaboration and cooperative problem-solving in relationships.
themes.description: This theme encourages couples to approach problems as a team, promoting a 'we're in this together' mentality and fostering unity rather than blame.

themes.scientific_basis: Inspired by creative problem-solving theories and brainstorming techniques.
themes.description: This theme provides space for each partner to suggest solutions without judgment, encouraging open-mindedness and collaborative brainstorming for effective resolution.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on growth mindset theory applied to relationships.
themes.description: This theme reframes conflicts as opportunities for growth, helping couples embrace challenges as a way to strengthen their relationship and learn more about each other.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in emotional regulation and stress management research.
themes.description: This theme helps couples identify ways to reduce stress before tackling issues, allowing them to approach problems from a calmer, more rational state of mind.

themes.scientific_basis: Inspired by negotiation theory and strategies for compromise.
themes.description: This theme equips couples with negotiation techniques, encouraging give-and-take to find mutually satisfying solutions to relationship challenges.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on research on compromise and fairness in relationships.
themes.description: This theme examines each partner's ability to make concessions when needed, fostering an environment where both feel their needs are valued and balanced.

themes.scientific_basis: Drawn from Gottman's research on managing 'gridlocked' conflicts and highly sensitive issues.
themes.description: This theme helps couples learn techniques for discussing sensitive or controversial topics with respect and empathy, encouraging constructive dialogue over reactive arguments.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in behavioral change and reinforcement theories.
themes.description: This theme emphasizes the need for couples to check back in after resolving an issue, ensuring solutions are effective and reinforcing positive changes over time.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on theories of acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) and relationship flexibility.
themes.description: This theme helps couples identify aspects they can change versus those to accept in each other, promoting realistic expectations and reducing frustration over unsolvable differences.
